str2: From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Idle, lazy, thoughtless, unprofitable, injurious. (by implication) lazy, useless.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
